author: bridge-bot
content:
<nero_eth> 1. Should blob transactions be enforceable with FOCIL? I think it makes sense, even though it's unfortunate, to exclude blob transactions in order to avoid making local block building (under peedDAS) more difficult. The downside is, if a rollup’s blobs are censored, the rollup would have to revert to calldata.

2. Having a delta of 0 and a deadline when the network "freezes" their view of local ILs feels problematic. Local ILs could cause attesters to have split views, complicating fork-choice. In this case, the attesters would need a more relaxed function to validate whether the block is valid.

author: terence0083
content: (1) can be done, but I don’t think we want to broadcast real IL transactions for blob transactions. I envision a hybrid design that utilizes the engine API’s get blobs endpoint, where only KZG commitments will be broadcasted
